required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surveillance of Safety and Efficacy of Wilate in Patients With Von Willebrand Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Surveillance of Safety and Efficacy of Wilate in Patients With Von Willebrand Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study, hence there is no study hypothesis

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (mean [± standard deviation (SD)]: 575 days [±326]; median [range]: 731 days [2-1185])
primary_outcome.description: Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) primary system organ class preferred term. Incidence rate = number of patients reporting the event / number of patients * 100

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability Assessment of Wilate Infusions by Reason for Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after each infusion of Wilate during the study.
primary_outcome.description: Tolerability was assessed using a 3-point verbal rating scale (excellent; satisfactory; unsatisfactory) according to overall feeling during and after Wilate therapy and occurrence of ADRs. Tolerability was assessed for infusions given for on-demand and prophylactic treatment, but not for infusions administered for surgeries or for the purpose of thrombogenicity assessment. In some instances, however, investigators also recorded the tolerability of infusions given for surgical prophylaxis. For infusions administered for surgeries, only those with available tolerability assessments are presented. Wilate infusion may have been administered to a patient for more than one reason and may be included in more than one category (e.g., if a patient was under Wilate prophylaxis, they could also receive Wilate for the treatment of a bleeding episode [BE] or surgery or menstruation).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient and Investigator Efficacy Analysis Assessment of the Treatment of Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after treatment of each BE.
secondary_outcome.description: Document the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of acute BEs, breakthrough BEs in patients receiving prophylactic treatment, and menstrual BEs. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy Analysis for the Prevention of Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study for each patient (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to the number of breakthrough bleeds per month. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population). In total, 25 patients received Wilate for prophylaxis and of these, 17 patients received prophylaxis on a continuous basis, which was defined as: (1) patients having received continuous prophylaxis over a period of at least 3 months, with no treatment gaps longer than 14 days; or (2) patients having received continuous prophylaxis for at least 1 year with an average of 1 infusion/per week (these patients may have had gaps of more than 14 days).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after each surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis during and after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Efficacy Assessment by Patient and Physician at the End of the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study for each patient (study duration: mean [±SD]: 596 days [±336]; median [range]: 732 days [2-1185]).
secondary_outcome.description: Patient and investigator assessment of the overall efficacy of Wilate performed at the end of the study for each patient. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none); criteria for assessment were not defined.

other_outcome.measure: Safety: Number of Exposure Days to Wilate
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 575 days [±326]; median [range]: 731 days [2-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number of exposure days to Wilate was documented throughout the observation period EDs = exposure days. IU = international unit. SD = standard deviation.

other_outcome.measure: Safety: Frequency of VWF Inhibitors at Baseline and Follow up
other_outcome.time_frame: Optional antibody tests were performed at baseline and 3-4 days (preferable 7 days) after Wilate injection.
other_outcome.description: Optional testing for anti-VWF antibodies/VWF inhibitor was performed at the baseline and follow up visits. VWF inhibitor testing was only performed if anti-VWF antibody results were positive. VWF antibody testing was performed using an ELISA assay, and inhibitor testing using a Bethesda assay. Both assays were considered experimental, since no standardized laboratory assays were available. Results displayed here are for confirmatory inhibitor testing.

other_outcome.measure: Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
other_outcome.time_frame: Optional antibody tests were performed at baseline and 3-4 days (preferable 7 days) after Wilate injection
other_outcome.description: Patients with a positive inhibitor test were assessed for ADRs related to anti VWF antibody or inhibitor development

other_outcome.measure: Safety: Patients With Thrombogenicity Values >2 Times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN)
other_outcome.time_frame: Optional thrombogenicity tests were performed at baseline and 1, 3 and 24 hours after each administration of Wilate.
other_outcome.description: Thrombogenicity testing was optional. Thrombogenicity markers (prothrombin fragments 1 + 2; D-dimer) were evaluated at baseline and during follow up. Samples with prothrombin F1+2 and/or D-dimer values at least 2 times above the upper limit of normal were recorded as high.

other_outcome.measure: Wilate Dosage Per Infusion for the Treatment of Acute Bleeding Episodes (BEs; On-demand)
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 677 days [±264]; median [range]: 749 days [40-1052]).
other_outcome.description: The number of infusions and dosage of Wilate administered for the on-demand treatment of acute BEs was documented throughout the study. n= number of infusions

other_outcome.measure: Wilate Dosage for the Treatment of Acute Bleeding Episodes (BEs; On-demand) Per Bleeding Episode (BE)
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 677 days [±264]; median [range]: 749 days [40-1052]).
other_outcome.description: The dosage of Wilate administered for the on-demand treatment of acute BEs was documented throughout the study. n = number of BEs

other_outcome.measure: Wilate Doses for the Treatment of Menstrual Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 553 days [±296]; median [range]: 713 days [125-840]).
other_outcome.description: Dosage of Wilate administered for treatment of menstrual BE's was documented throughout the study. n = number of BEs treated

other_outcome.measure: Exposure Days for Prophylactic Treatment With Wilate
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population).

other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population). n = number of patients.

other_outcome.measure: Dosage for Prophylactic Treatment With Wilate Per Week
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population). n = number of patients

other_outcome.measure: Dosage for Prophylactic Treatment With Wilate Per Infusion
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population).

other_outcome.measure: Exposure Days for Prophylactic Wilate Treatment on a Continuous Basis
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as prophylactic treatment on a continuous basis were documented throughout the study. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Infusions Per Week for Prophylactic Wilate Treatment on a Continuous Basis
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as prophylactic treatment on a continuous basis were documented throughout the study. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Dosage for Prophylactic Wilate Treatment on a Continuous Basis
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as prophylactic treatment on a continuous basis were documented throughout the study. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. n = number of patients.

other_outcome.measure: Dosage for Prophylactic Wilate Treatment Per Infusion on a Continuous Basis
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as prophylactic treatment on a continuous basis were documented throughout the study. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. n = number of infusions.

other_outcome.measure: Dosage of Wilate Per Infusion for the Treatment of Breakthrough Bleeds
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 561 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as treatment for breakthrough bleeds in patients receiving prophylactic treatment on a continuous or intermittent basis were documented throughout the study. n = number of infusions

other_outcome.measure: Dosage of Wilate for the Treatment of Breakthrough Bleeds Per Breakthrough Bleed
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 561 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered as treatment for breakthrough bleeds in patients receiving prophylactic treatment on a continuous or intermittent basis were documented throughout the study. n = For 1 bleed in the EFF-PC population, the dose is unknown.

other_outcome.measure: Wilate Dosage Per Infusion for the Prevention of Bleeding During and After Surgery
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 568 days [±349]; median [range]: 732 days [2-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered to prevent bleeding during and after surgery were documented throughout the study. For 6 infusions, no dosage information is available One minor surgical procedure was not treated with Wilate. For 2 of the 98 treated surgical procedures, no dosage information is available (i.e., 1 major orthopaedic surgery and 1 minor cardiovascular surgery)

other_outcome.measure: Wilate Dosage Per Procedure for the Prevention of Bleeding During and After Surgery
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 568 days [±349]; median [range]: 732 days [2-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered to prevent bleeding during and after surgery were documented throughout the study. For 6 infusions, no dosage information is available One minor surgical procedure was not treated with Wilate. For 2 of the 98 treated surgical procedures, no dosage information is available (i.e., 1 major orthopedic surgery and 1 minor cardiovascular surgery)

other_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
other_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
other_outcome.description: Breakthrough bleeds in patients receiving Wilate as prophylactic treatment on a continuous (EFF-PC population) or intermittent (EFF-PI population) basis were documented throughout the study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients using Wilate as standard of care treatment
arm_group.description: This patient population is being treated with Wilate as standard of care treatment

intervention.intervention_name: Patients using Wilate as standard of care
intervention.description: Patients with von Willebrand Disease using Wilate for a period of 2 years.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients using Wilate as standard of care treatment

study_pop.textblock: VWD patients of any gender, age, or VWD type

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of von Willebrand Disease who have been prescribed Wilate

facility.name: Fundación de la Hemofilia de Salta
Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children

group.title: Wilate
group.description: A total of 120 patients were enrolled in this study. Of the 120 patients enrolled into the study, 9 were excluded because they had not received any treatment with Wilate, leaving 111 patients in the safety (SAF) population. Of these 111 patients, 7 did not have a confirmed diagnosis of von Willebrand Disease (VWD) and 2 had another bleeding disorder, leaving 102 patients in the intention-to-treat (ITT) population. Of these 102 patients, 11 were excluded from the efficacy (EFF) population for the reasons summarised below.

baseline.population: The SAF population consisted of 111 patients who received at least one dose of Wilate during the study.

group.title: SAF Population
group.description: Of the 120 patients enrolled in this study, 111 received at least one dose of Wilate and were included in the SAF population

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Height
Weight
Body mass index
Family history of Von Willebrand Disease (VWD)
Time since diagnosis
Type of VWD
measure.description: Von Willebrand disease (VWD) is a genetic bleeding disorder caused by missing or defective von Willebrand factor (VWF) which is a clotting protein. There are three types of VWD: Type 1, 2 and 3. Type 1 VWD patients have a quantitative deficiency of VWF. Levels of VWF in the blood range from 20%–50% of normal; symptoms are usually mild. Type 2 VWD patients have a qualitative deficiency in VWF. Symptoms are mild to moderate. Type 3 VWD patients have a quantitative deficiency of VWF. Symptoms are typically severe, and include spontaneous bleeding episodes, often into their joints and muscles.

measure.title: History of Von Willebrand Factor (VWF) inhibitor activity
Known gene mutation
Prestudy exposure to Factor VIII (FVIII)/Von Willebrand factor (VWF) products in exposure days (ED)s

outcome.title: Incidence of Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs) (%)
outcome.description: Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) primary system organ class preferred term. Incidence rate = number of patients reporting the event / number of patients * 100
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (mean [± standard deviation (SD)]: 575 days [±326]; median [range]: 731 days [2-1185])
outcome.population: All patients who received at least one dose of Wilate during the study (SAF population).

group.title: SAF Population
group.description: All patients treated with at least one dose of Wilate during the study.

measure.title: Incidence of Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs) (%)
measure.description: Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) primary system organ class preferred term. Incidence rate = number of patients reporting the event / number of patients * 100
measure.population: All patients who received at least one dose of Wilate during the study (SAF population).

outcome.title: Tolerability Assessment of Wilate Infusions by Reason for Administration
outcome.description: Tolerability was assessed using a 3-point verbal rating scale (excellent; satisfactory; unsatisfactory) according to overall feeling during and after Wilate therapy and occurrence of ADRs. Tolerability was assessed for infusions given for on-demand and prophylactic treatment, but not for infusions administered for surgeries or for the purpose of thrombogenicity assessment. In some instances, however, investigators also recorded the tolerability of infusions given for surgical prophylaxis. For infusions administered for surgeries, only those with available tolerability assessments are presented. Wilate infusion may have been administered to a patient for more than one reason and may be included in more than one category (e.g., if a patient was under Wilate prophylaxis, they could also receive Wilate for the treatment of a bleeding episode [BE] or surgery or menstruation).
outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after each infusion of Wilate during the study.
outcome.population: The tolerability analysis was performed in the SAF population; however, not all of the 111 participants experienced bleeding or had surgery or menstruation.

group.title: Prophylaxis
group.description: Wilate administered to patients in the context of prophylactic treatment.

group.title: Bleeding
group.description: Wilate administered for the treatment of acute or breakthrough BEs (does not include menstrual BEs).

group.title: Surgery
group.description: Wilate administered in the context of surgery.

group.title: Menstruation
group.description: Wilate administered in the context of menstrual BEs.

group.title: Prevention
group.description: Wilate administered for the purpose of preventing recurrent BEs in patients undergoing on-demand treatment or short-term prophylaxis in surgery only.

measure.title: Tolerability Assessment of Wilate Infusions by Reason for Administration
measure.description: Tolerability was assessed using a 3-point verbal rating scale (excellent; satisfactory; unsatisfactory) according to overall feeling during and after Wilate therapy and occurrence of ADRs. Tolerability was assessed for infusions given for on-demand and prophylactic treatment, but not for infusions administered for surgeries or for the purpose of thrombogenicity assessment. In some instances, however, investigators also recorded the tolerability of infusions given for surgical prophylaxis. For infusions administered for surgeries, only those with available tolerability assessments are presented. Wilate infusion may have been administered to a patient for more than one reason and may be included in more than one category (e.g., if a patient was under Wilate prophylaxis, they could also receive Wilate for the treatment of a bleeding episode [BE] or surgery or menstruation).
measure.population: The tolerability analysis was performed in the SAF population; however, not all of the 111 participants experienced bleeding or had surgery or menstruation.

outcome.title: Patient and Investigator Efficacy Analysis Assessment of the Treatment of Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
outcome.description: Document the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of acute BEs, breakthrough BEs in patients receiving prophylactic treatment, and menstrual BEs. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis.
outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after treatment of each BE.
outcome.population: From all the patients in the EFF population, 58 patients experienced one or more evaluable BEs; 24 patients experienced acute BEs, 25 patients experienced breakthrough BEs and 9 experienced menstrual BEs.

group.title: Patient Assessment of Acute BEs
group.description: Patient assessment of the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of acute BEs.

group.title: Investigator Assessment of Acute BEs
group.description: Investigator assessment of the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of acute BEs.

group.title: Patient Assessment of Breakthrough BEs
group.description: Patient assessment of the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of breakthrough BEs.

group.title: Investigator Assessment of Breakthrough BEs
group.description: Investigator assessment on the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of breakthrough BEs.

group.title: Patient Assessment of Menstrual BEs
group.description: Patient assessment on the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of menstrual BEs.

group.title: Investigator Assessment of Menstrual BEs
group.description: Investigator assessment on the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of menstrual BEs.

measure.title: Patient and Investigator Efficacy Analysis Assessment of the Treatment of Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
measure.description: Document the efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of acute BEs, breakthrough BEs in patients receiving prophylactic treatment, and menstrual BEs. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis.
measure.population: From all the patients in the EFF population, 58 patients experienced one or more evaluable BEs; 24 patients experienced acute BEs, 25 patients experienced breakthrough BEs and 9 experienced menstrual BEs.

outcome.title: Efficacy Analysis for the Prevention of Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to the number of breakthrough bleeds per month. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population). In total, 25 patients received Wilate for prophylaxis and of these, 17 patients received prophylaxis on a continuous basis, which was defined as: (1) patients having received continuous prophylaxis over a period of at least 3 months, with no treatment gaps longer than 14 days; or (2) patients having received continuous prophylaxis for at least 1 year with an average of 1 infusion/per week (these patients may have had gaps of more than 14 days).
outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study for each patient (study duration: mean [±SD]: 805 days [±247]; median [range]: 797 days [144-1185]).
outcome.population: The efficacy results for the 17 patients with continuous prophylaxis are described here (EFF-PC population).

group.title: Spontaneous
group.description: Spontaneous bleeding causes

group.title: All Causes
group.description: All causes of bleeding episodes

measure.title: Efficacy Analysis for the Prevention of Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
measure.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to the number of breakthrough bleeds per month. The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population). In total, 25 patients received Wilate for prophylaxis and of these, 17 patients received prophylaxis on a continuous basis, which was defined as: (1) patients having received continuous prophylaxis over a period of at least 3 months, with no treatment gaps longer than 14 days; or (2) patients having received continuous prophylaxis for at least 1 year with an average of 1 infusion/per week (these patients may have had gaps of more than 14 days).
measure.population: The efficacy results for the 17 patients with continuous prophylaxis are described here (EFF-PC population).

outcome.title: Efficacy Analysis of Surgical Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis during and after surgery.
outcome.time_frame: During and immediately after each surgery.
outcome.population: All patients in the EFF population who underwent surgery under the cover of Wilate (efficacy subpopulation undergoing surgery (EFF-S) population), divided according to surgery type. Efficacy assessments were available for 51/52 minor and 46/46 major surgeries.

group.title: Minor Surgeries
group.description: Efficacy analysis for minor surgeries including treatment with Wilate.

group.title: Major Surgeries
group.description: Efficacy analysis for major surgeries including treatment with Wilate.

measure.title: Efficacy Analysis of Surgical Prophylaxis
measure.description: Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none) according to overall haemostasis during and after surgery.
measure.population: All patients in the EFF population who underwent surgery under the cover of Wilate (efficacy subpopulation undergoing surgery (EFF-S) population), divided according to surgery type. Efficacy assessments were available for 51/52 minor and 46/46 major surgeries.

outcome.title: Overall Efficacy Assessment by Patient and Physician at the End of the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Patient and investigator assessment of the overall efficacy of Wilate performed at the end of the study for each patient. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none); criteria for assessment were not defined.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of the study for each patient (study duration: mean [±SD]: 596 days [±336]; median [range]: 732 days [2-1185]).
outcome.population: Overall efficacy assessments in the EFF population (n=91) were available from 78 patients, and investigator assessments were available for 86 patients.

measure.title: Overall Efficacy Assessment by Patient and Physician at the End of the Treatment Period
measure.description: Patient and investigator assessment of the overall efficacy of Wilate performed at the end of the study for each patient. Efficacy was rated on a 4-point scale (excellent; good; moderate; none); criteria for assessment were not defined.
measure.population: Overall efficacy assessments in the EFF population (n=91) were available from 78 patients, and investigator assessments were available for 86 patients.

measure.title: Safety: Number of Exposure Days to Wilate
measure.description: Number of exposure days to Wilate was documented throughout the observation period EDs = exposure days. IU = international unit. SD = standard deviation.
measure.population: All patients who received at least one dose of Wilate during the study (SAF Population).

outcome.title: Safety: Frequency of VWF Inhibitors at Baseline and Follow up
outcome.description: Optional testing for anti-VWF antibodies/VWF inhibitor was performed at the baseline and follow up visits. VWF inhibitor testing was only performed if anti-VWF antibody results were positive. VWF antibody testing was performed using an ELISA assay, and inhibitor testing using a Bethesda assay. Both assays were considered experimental, since no standardized laboratory assays were available. Results displayed here are for confirmatory inhibitor testing.
outcome.time_frame: Optional antibody tests were performed at baseline and 3-4 days (preferable 7 days) after Wilate injection.
outcome.population: Data was analysed for all patients in the SAF population who underwent VWF inhibitor testing. Results were not available at all visits for all patients.

group.description: Inhibitor results from patients at baseline

measure.title: Safety: Frequency of VWF Inhibitors at Baseline and Follow up
measure.description: Optional testing for anti-VWF antibodies/VWF inhibitor was performed at the baseline and follow up visits. VWF inhibitor testing was only performed if anti-VWF antibody results were positive. VWF antibody testing was performed using an ELISA assay, and inhibitor testing using a Bethesda assay. Both assays were considered experimental, since no standardized laboratory assays were available. Results displayed here are for confirmatory inhibitor testing.
measure.population: Data was analysed for all patients in the SAF population who underwent VWF inhibitor testing. Results were not available at all visits for all patients.

outcome.title: Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
outcome.description: Patients with a positive inhibitor test were assessed for ADRs related to anti VWF antibody or inhibitor development
outcome.time_frame: Optional antibody tests were performed at baseline and 3-4 days (preferable 7 days) after Wilate injection
outcome.population: ADRs were assessed for all patients who has a positive VWF inhibitor testing result as described in outcome 8.

measure.description: Patients with a positive inhibitor test were assessed for ADRs related to anti VWF antibody or inhibitor development
measure.population: ADRs were assessed for all patients who has a positive VWF inhibitor testing result as described in outcome 8.

outcome.title: Safety: Patients With Thrombogenicity Values >2 Times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN)
outcome.description: Thrombogenicity testing was optional. Thrombogenicity markers (prothrombin fragments 1 + 2; D-dimer) were evaluated at baseline and during follow up. Samples with prothrombin F1+2 and/or D-dimer values at least 2 times above the upper limit of normal were recorded as high.
outcome.time_frame: Optional thrombogenicity tests were performed at baseline and 1, 3 and 24 hours after each administration of Wilate.
outcome.population: A total of 47 patients were assessed over multiple visits. Results were not available at all visits for all patients.

group.description: Post-infusion assessment of D-dimer (>2-fold ULN)

measure.title: Safety: Patients With Thrombogenicity Values >2 Times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN)
measure.description: Thrombogenicity testing was optional. Thrombogenicity markers (prothrombin fragments 1 + 2; D-dimer) were evaluated at baseline and during follow up. Samples with prothrombin F1+2 and/or D-dimer values at least 2 times above the upper limit of normal were recorded as high.
measure.population: A total of 47 patients were assessed over multiple visits. Results were not available at all visits for all patients.

outcome.title: Wilate Dosage Per Infusion for the Treatment of Acute Bleeding Episodes (BEs; On-demand)
outcome.description: The number of infusions and dosage of Wilate administered for the on-demand treatment of acute BEs was documented throughout the study. n= number of infusions
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 677 days [±264]; median [range]: 749 days [40-1052]).
outcome.population: Bleeding episodes (BEs) occurring in the efficacy on-demand (EFF-OD) population that included 25 patients. Menstrual BEs were excluded from this analysis.

group.title: Dose of Wilate Per Infusion, IU/kg Per Infusion
group.description: Dose of Wilate given on-demand per infusion, units per kg per infusion

measure.population: Bleeding episodes (BEs) occurring in the efficacy on-demand (EFF-OD) population that included 25 patients. Menstrual BEs were excluded from this analysis.

outcome.title: Wilate Doses for the Treatment of Menstrual Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
outcome.description: Dosage of Wilate administered for treatment of menstrual BE's was documented throughout the study. n = number of BEs treated
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 553 days [±296]; median [range]: 713 days [125-840]).
outcome.population: Nine patients from the EFF population had a total of 56 menstrual BEs treated with Wilate.

group.title: Dose of Wilate Per Menstrual BE, IU/kg Per Menstrual BE
group.description: Dose of Wilate given to participants per menstrual BE, units per kg per menstrual BE

measure.title: Wilate Doses for the Treatment of Menstrual Bleeding Episodes (BEs)
measure.description: Dosage of Wilate administered for treatment of menstrual BE's was documented throughout the study. n = number of BEs treated
measure.population: Nine patients from the EFF population had a total of 56 menstrual BEs treated with Wilate.

outcome.title: Exposure Days for Prophylactic Treatment With Wilate
outcome.description: The treatment regimen for prophylactic treatment was at the discretion of the investigator and differed for each patient, as did the duration of prophylactic treatment. The prophylaxis efficacy population (EFF-P) was subdivided into 2 groups, prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) and prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population).
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
outcome.population: Patients receiving prophylactic treatment (n=25) on either a continuous basis (EFF-PC population) or an intermittent basis (EFF-PI population).

group.title: Number of Exposure Days
group.description: Number of prophylactic exposure days.

outcome.title: Wilate Dosage Per Infusion for the Prevention of Bleeding During and After Surgery
outcome.description: Number and dosage of Wilate infusions administered to prevent bleeding during and after surgery were documented throughout the study. For 6 infusions, no dosage information is available One minor surgical procedure was not treated with Wilate. For 2 of the 98 treated surgical procedures, no dosage information is available (i.e., 1 major orthopaedic surgery and 1 minor cardiovascular surgery)
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 568 days [±349]; median [range]: 732 days [2-1185]).
outcome.population: Efficacy of Wilate for the prevention of bleeding during and after surgery was assessed in the efficacy surgery (EFF-S) population that included 62 patients.

group.title: Dose of Wilate Per Infusion, IU/kg Per Infusion
group.description: Dose of Wilate per infusion, units per kg in patients following surgery.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Breakthrough bleeds in patients receiving Wilate as prophylactic treatment on a continuous (EFF-PC population) or intermittent (EFF-PI population) basis were documented throughout the study.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient's participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 761 days [±251]; median [range]: 773 days [144-1185]).
outcome.population: Patients who received Wilate as prophylaxis were sub-divided into those who received prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC Population) and those who received prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI).

group.title: EFF-PC
group.description: Efficacy population undergoing continuous prophylaxis.

group.title: EFF-PI
group.description: Efficacy population undergoing intermittent prophylaxis.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Breakthrough Bleeds During Prophylaxis
measure.description: Breakthrough bleeds in patients receiving Wilate as prophylactic treatment on a continuous (EFF-PC population) or intermittent (EFF-PI population) basis were documented throughout the study.
measure.population: Patients who received Wilate as prophylaxis were sub-divided into those who received prophylaxis on a continuous basis (EFF-PC Population) and those who received prophylaxis on an intermittent basis (EFF-PI).

outcome.title: Thromboembolic Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
outcome.description: Patients with elevated F1 + F2 and/or D-dimer levels were monitored for thromboembolic ADRs
outcome.time_frame: Optional thrombogenicity tests were performed at baseline and 1,3 and 24 hours after each administration of Wilate
outcome.population: Thromboembolic ADRs were analysed for all patients who has elevated F1 + F2 and/or D-dimer levels >2 times the upper limit of normal as identified in outcome 11.

group.title: Prothrombin (Pre-infusion)
group.description: Pre-infusion assessment of prothrombin F1 + 2 (>2-fold ULN)

group.title: Prothrombin (Post-infusion)
group.description: Post-infusion assessment of prothrombin F1 + 2 (>2-fold ULN)

group.title: D-Dimer (Pre-infusion)
group.description: Pre-infusion assessment of D-dimer (>2-fold ULN)

group.title: D-Dimer (Post-infusion)
group.description: Post-infusion assessment of D-dimer (>2-fold ULN)

measure.title: Thromboembolic Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
measure.description: Patients with elevated F1 + F2 and/or D-dimer levels were monitored for thromboembolic ADRs
measure.population: Thromboembolic ADRs were analysed for all patients who has elevated F1 + F2 and/or D-dimer levels >2 times the upper limit of normal as identified in outcome 11.

outcome.title: Clinical Symptoms of Von Willebrand Factor (VWF) Inhibition
outcome.description: Patients with a positive inhibitor tests were assessed for clinical symptoms of VWF inhibition
outcome.time_frame: Optional antibody tests were performed at baseline and 3-4 days (preferable 7 days) after Wilate injection
outcome.population: Data was assessed for all patients in the SAF population who had a positive VWF inhibitor testing result as described in outcome 8.

group.title: Baseline
group.description: Inhibitor results from patients at baseline

group.title: Follow-up
group.description: Inhibitor results from patients at follow-up

measure.title: Clinical Symptoms of Von Willebrand Factor (VWF) Inhibition
measure.description: Patients with a positive inhibitor tests were assessed for clinical symptoms of VWF inhibition
measure.population: Data was assessed for all patients in the SAF population who had a positive VWF inhibitor testing result as described in outcome 8.

reported_events.time_frame: Throughout the duration of each patient’s participation in the study (study duration: mean [±SD]: 575 days [±326]; median [range]: 731 days [2–1185]).

group.title: SAF Population
group.description: All patients who received at least one dose of Wilate during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
